page.description: Converts a numeric expression to a character expression.

argument.name: ascii_value
argument.description: A number from -255 through 255, inclusive. Numeric

page.discussion: CHR() returns the Single_Character corresponding to the integer ASCII_Value. Note : The ASCII_Value used in the ALT-value sequence for typing a non-standard character is not always the same value that CHR() requires. For example ALT 241 produces " ", but CHR(-79) produces " ". To determine the value required by the CHR() function, use the ASC() function first, as in ASC(" ").
page.example: chr(68) -> "D" chr( asc(CITY) ) -> "M", if CITY contains "Montreal"
